Description: Body sherd of large Chian black-figured Animal pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (mostly lost); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of lower part of a cock, to left, with right leg stepping forward; part of further animal(?) at left break.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Stage 4 of her Black Figure Animal Chalice group. Some of the vases in this group have a unique rim pattern and have filling ornament; the birds featured on the cups are well proportioned and balanced. It must be noted that this sherd has no filling ornament. She also places the sherd in Stage 2 of that group, all made by the same artist; the composition is well-balanced and the images are precise; with a repeated pattern of incisions. Incision marks on this sherd are not the same as those on British Museum 1886,0401.1563, which Lemos also places in this group.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 87.)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 165, p. 173, p. 331, no. 1593)
Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p. 131, fig. 21)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1281) (phase 2)
